basics.name: Marina Andreianova
basics.label: Political Scientist / Master of Art in Baltic Sea Region Studies

work.company: Baltic Region Healthy Cities Association (Turku, Finland)
work.summary: The Baltic Region Healthy Cities Association based in Turku, Finland, aims at increasing awareness of the local governments to take health as a central part in the decision making process in the cities belonging to the WHO Healthy Cities Networks.The Association’s role is to promote this ideology and facilitate the governance processes in the European Healthy Cities.
highlights: Preparation and execution of international projects and applications
Search for appropriate donation funds and interested institutions to provide necessary financial resources for project implementation

Day-to-day communication with project beneficiaries (terms, dates,activities) and project implementing institutions (project plan, quality control, feedback, post-project analysis, follow up activities)

work.company: Immanuel Kant Baltic Federal University (Kalinigrad, Russia)
work.summary:
The strategic goal of the IKBFU is to increase and secure competitiveness in the national and global markets of university education and R&D through developing competences in new areas and activities in line with the breakthrough achievements in the field of biomedical, neuro-, nanotechnology as well as in social sciences and the humanities.
I participated in several international scientific projects. In addition I was involved in educational methodical complex development, sociological surveys, interviewing people and general office work.
highlights: Running field interviews for further analysis of collected data
Development and delivery of lectures to project actors
Document analysis (regional, federal and international mass media)
Active participation in study visits - developing collaboration and share of experience

work.company: NGO Centre Youth for Freedom of Speech (Kalinigrad, Russia)
work.summary: This position implied the realisation of a project developed by Charity Children's Fund 'Victoria' to support orphans. I worked as a project manager and contributed to project via team building and event development
highlights: Preparatory workshop for potential volunteers: group activities, problem-solving tasks, case-studies, group and individual presentations, project roles and beneficiary-oriented behaviour
Development and delivery of lectures to project actors

Development of website for volunteers and dissemination of necessary information among them. Monitoring volunteers’ activities and taking into account problematic points in order to avoid them in the future Event development

volunteer.summary: 'REAL/ VIRTUAL' is the launch of a 5 month programme of events which explore the boundaries of reality and virtuality. This festival featured exhibitions, installations, performances and workshops

volunteer.organization: National Centre of Contemporary Arts (Kaliningrad, Russia)
volunteer.summary: Kaliningrad Branch of NCCA is the only institution in the Kaliningrad region working directly in the field of contemporary art. Its aim is to implement the state cultural policy on contemporary art through exhibition, collecting, information, education and research activities both in Russia and abroad.
highlights: Collecting material and data for the excursions

education.institution: Immanuel Kant Baltic Federal University (Kaliningrad, Russia)
Immanuel Kant Baltic Federal University (Kaliningrad, Russia)

awards.summary: Stipend covering academic year during Erasmus exchange

awards.title: Aurora - Towards Modern and Innovative Higher Education
awards.summary: Stipend covering 14 months of Masters degree

skills.name: Project implementation
keywords: searching for information and report writing
